reviewText:
You get what you pay for.
a fun but limited deathmatch game that has no one playing online

the bots you play against are way too easy and they cheat like crazy. unlimited boost, they tailgate you forever while airbraking. they dont stall but you do.
they are way too easy, very repetitive and only become dangerous in groups
(even on the hardest setting)

it could use better controller support,
allthough it works well enough using one.
the way they work make menu choices slow and tedious.
instead of jumping through the options,
a controller gives you a slow moving arrow as you use a mouse.
ingame they work well enough

the multiplayer part is dead, no one online

i give it a 6/10 overall.
would be more if there actually was anyone online.

it's ok for some mindless fun

reviewText:
I have over 600 games in my Steam account, and the vast majority of them are still unplayed. So now I'm dedicating an hour to each of these games and writing a series of One Hour Reviews. An hour isn't very long to judge a game on, so think of this as more of a first impression, and take this review in the spirit in which it's given. Be sure to read other reviews from players who have spent more time in the game.

One Hour Reviews #49 - DogFighter

Exactly as you'd expect from the title, DogFighter pits you as a fighter pilot against a number of other pilots.  It's pretty much deathmatch with propellar planes, which isn't itself a bad thing.

I started with the tutorial, which does a perfectly good job taking you through the various controls in the game.   The left stick controls the plane, while the right stick is used for performing different maneuvers, which include barrel rolls in either direction, a loop, and an Immelmann turn.

Much like a typical deathmatch game, you pick up powerups, which can provide both offensive and defensive capabilities.  Offensive items are activated with the right trigger, and defensive items are activated with the left trigger.

The flight model is completely arcade-like, so anyone expecting simulator level realism should look elsewhere.  But, on the flip side, the game is very easy to pick up.

The game offers some different game modes, but they don't really change the core gameplay which is to fly your plane, shoot other plans, and don't get shot down.  All of the game modes are just variations of the basic deathmatch.

Which brings me to the problem I had with this game.  You can't really have a deathmatch game without other people playing it.  And nobody seems to be playing this anymore.  Granted, this game came out back in 2010, but sadly it seems the shelf life of this game was pretty short, and people have moved on.  So, unless you fancy playing deathmatch with a bunch of bots, you are better off looking at other games.

Some of the bad characteristics of the game is the repetitive stalling, although the fun of the battles helps supress that frustration.

93/100
-Your Captain Pot8

reviewText:
DogFighter is an extremely fun flight combat game. The level of customization, the decent number of maps and the plethora of game modes really sell this game. DogFighter is more than a dogfighting simulator, it is a dogfighting game. You should totally get this game while it is cheap.

It is tough to find a match online but when you do get into a match the game is totally worth it.

If you haven't already listened to me and bought this game, you sir are a fool. Primarily because you didn't listen to me.

Verdict: BUY

reviewText: There are some ideas that are so simple that passionate developers ruin them by making things more difficult than they have to be.  My major complaint with this game is the controls.  There are too many for a casual game like this.  Also, this game takes a lot of tweaking to respond semi-smoothly -- mouse sensitivity (never did figure out the game pad).  All in all, the maps seem pretty standard.  The planes aren't based on Flight Simulator mechanics, but I wasn't expecting that.  I kind of just wanted to start this game up and have fun.  I didn't want to fiddle with it forever.\n\nThis games needs simplification and also should be optimized for slower PC's.  I don't recommend buying this.

reviewText:
I am reluctant to trash a game with so little gameplay minutes but this game puts forward all it has to offer very quickly. Unfortunately it is not quite as good as one could have hoped after seeing the trailer.

The trailer video shows ultra-tight multiplay fun and really fast flying! ...but in reality the speed is not there. Boost does not add much. There are also zero people online.

And the controls: Play it with a gamepad and aiming is hell. Play it with a flightstick and the twitchy gameplay will be hell for you and your stick.  Play it with a mouse and you will get trashed in the close quarters turns. I simply was not able to find a proper control scheme that worked. Mouse was the best though.

A flying arcade game can be fast and playable on multiple control types. e.g. Skydrift.

It is not an entirely lost case though. Game is probably at it's best when played with a few friends who are all of the same skill level. This could probably be quite nice LAN game among friends. But playing against the few random humans online or bots? Forget it. Not worth it even at this price.

4/10

reviewText: Was hoping this to be related in some way to the fantastic but old dogfigher game where you fly in the house and fight with toys.\n\nThe game lacks polish. The UI  (menus, dialogs, controls) are aweful. There is no way to control or change the settings while in the tutorial. If I need to invert the axes or change mouse sensitivity I have to quit and restart the tutorial. Enabling realistic flight mode made the plane move like a snake. absolutely out of control. May be the controls are better with xbox controller, but the lack of polish everywhere makes me doubt that. For 2.99 it is probably a very good game for a young kid. But for any serious players its waste of money and slot on steam.

reviewText: Neat little game that I could accustom it to Quake or that style of arena FPS but with planes and the constraints of them. Its interesting and somewhat fun, but on Team Death Match when playing in singleplayer the friendly AI are useless unfortunately. Though Deathmatch is still fun but even on hard the AI dont really stand much of a chance against a real human. Since this game is so old though and it was a mainly multiplayer focused game the multiplayer is expectantly dead at this point. No one is online aside from a few crazed and forgotten souls in limbo.\n\nSince it is a multiplayer focused game and dead, and the singleplayer component isn't that challenging or fun I would advise not buying this game unless you have a group already interested in playing the game as you will need other people to play with to get the most out of the game. Though it is some fun to just fly around blasting bots its not that fun for a very long time.

reviewText:
DISCLAIMER: This is a first impressions review, and NOT a full review, if you want a full review, then please read better reviews then mine
PLEASE NOTE: If I (the reviewer) have played a game that has less than 1 hour of gameplay and is not recommended, means that I did not enjoy or it did not live up to my expectations! Think twice before rating or giving out a comment...
DogFighter is basically a dog fighting game. Sadly, this game relies heavily on multiplayer and hardly anyone plays this game, so I cannot review it properly

Overall the graphics are okay, music and sound effects are okay and controls are very sensitive. I can tell that this game can get really repetitive very quickly...

NOT RECOMMENDED :(

reviewText: Not exactly Crimson Skies but this is a fun little pick me up game. I got this for free via the BundleStars give away and me and a bunch of friends also got it. Nothing more satisfying than hearing the agonizing screams of my friends as they get pummeled from unexpected sides. Definitely better with a controller than a keyboard/mouse combination. I haven't had the issues previously mentioned, but some of my friends ran into problems because they accidentally set their resolution to an unsupported refresh rate. Why they would show you unsupported refresh rates to begin with is a mystery.

reviewText:
Developers are great, had a problem where the game wouldn't start but they released an update which fixed it in a reasonable time. Thanks. http://steamcommunity.com/app/42500/discussions/0/405690850598851768/

First impressions;
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Ok, so this is a pure arcade dogfighting game through and through.
No story mode as far as I can tell; only 'arena style' deathmatch dogfighting variations, includes a number of singleplayer tournaments.
You earn medals based on your performance.

It's quite good if that is what you are looking for though.
Pickup 'powerups', new weapons, health packs, shields, disrupters, etc.
Can use buttons with preset manoeuvres if you like; loop, barrel roll, 180 degree turn, etc. (sorry not the correct terminology)

I would say would be really fun in multiplayer with 'like-minded' friends.
Game does have bots, but they can be tough, especially if 5 vs 1 (lone wolf mode) etc.

Took me quite a while to get my control sensitivities to how I like them as there are 4x sliders in reference to this. But putting the time into setting those paid off.
Also, this game has an excellent tutorial.

Recommended if this is what you are looking for.

reviewText:
I remember playing this a few years ago all the time.
At that time people were always on it which made it flipping fun.

For the price it's a must, you can still host lobbies with your friends, and solo against the bots on hard mode, which probably simulates online multiplayer at its best.

The graphics are not towards realism so think of it as an arcade game.
Arcade sound, arcade graphics, a free flight arcade battle game.

Really fun, get it!
The only sad thing is that I went to look at multiplayer and no servers existed or my firewall was blocking the game.
I'll try messing with the firewall tomorrow and I'll edit this review if anything new came up.

(If this review helped you, one-up it and maybe even comment on it, thanks!)

reviewText:
Oh wow.

This is a really good game.

Quite honestly, I don't understand all the hate. This game is fantastic! The movement is much better than a few other flight games I have played (*ahem* IL2 Sturmovik *ahem*) and the combat is fluent. And so far I've only played with bots. That has to say something about game, right? The different planes you can choose feel different, and you can tell if one is different or not. Really good fun.

Oh, and I did get a free key from bundle stars, but I would happily pay for this.
